titleproper.value:
Guide to the Records of the Puerto Rico Project
                    <num>RISM RG 3</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Emilyn L. Brown. Inventory prepared by Katie Ehrlich and Stephanie Schmeling, September 2010.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2013-03-04T11:01-0500</date>

unittitle.value: Records of the Puerto Rico Study

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The Puerto Rico Project was a comprehensive study conducted by Dr. Julian H. Steward and a select team of anthropologists between 1947 and 1949. The collection includes correspondence, minutes, interviews, reports, journal accounts, fieldwork reports, printed matter, manuscripts, thesis, maps, and ephemera.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, Date(s) (if known); The Records of the Puerto Rico Project; RISM RG 3; box number; folder number;
                <lb/>
                <address>
                    <addressline>Research Institute for the Study of Man Collection</addressline>
                    <addressline>New York University Archives</addressline>
                    <addressline>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library</addressline>
                    <addressline>70 Washington Square South</addressline>
                    <addressline>New York, NY 10012</addressline>
                </address>

Two items, formerly housed in RISM's Library for Caribbean Research (LCR), have been appended to the collection. Report on the Selection of a Community for Anthropological Study, a thesis written by Irene Caro, documents fieldwork in Puerto Rico and contains a valuable glossary of common terms in the Spanish language. The second document, Canamelar: The Subculture of a Rural Sugar Plantation Proletariat, written by Sidney Mintz, appears to be a chapter of a larger, unidentified manuscript.

subject.value: Puerto Rico |x Social life and customs.

corpname.value: University of Puerto Rico (Rio Piedras Campus).

dsc.value:
Series I: Correspondence, April 1948 - August 1950, undated Scope and Contents note

7 folders, arranged chronologically. This series consists of incoming and outgoing letters between fieldworkers in Puerto Rico and field director John Murra in New York.

 Correspondence 1 1 Apr-Jun 1948 Correspondence 1 2 Jul 1948 Correspondence 1 3 Aug 1948 Correspondence 1 4 Sep 1948 Correspondence 1 5 Oct-Nov 1948 Correspondence 1 6 Jun 1949-Aug 1950 Correspondence 1 7 undated Series II: Minutes, December 1947 - January 1949 Scope and Contents note

9 folders, arranged chronologically. This series mainly consists of minutes generated during Project conferences and meetings. The papers, which highlight planning details and methodology of fieldwork investigation, include agendas, minutes, research categories, work plans and notes. Several reports referenced in the minutes are also included.

 Typescript minutes, notes, ephemera 1 8 Dec 1947-Feb 1948 Proposed conference agenda, research categories 1 9 May 1948 Minutes, reports 1 10 May 1948 Minutes, community studies form, notes 1 11 May 1948-June 1948, undated Notes (handwritten) 1 12 May 1948, undated Typescript minutes 1 13 May 1948-Jun 1948, undated Typescript minutes, notes 1 14 Jun 1948-Jul 1948, undated Typescript and handwritten minutes 1 15 Jul 1948 Project metting work plan, class taxonomy by community, comparative community data 1 16 Jan 1949 Series III: Interviews, August - October 1948, undated Scope and Contents note

5 folders, arranged chronologically. This series consists of typescript field interviews conducted by Sidney Mintz and Charles Rosario, a student at the University of Puerto Rico. Coded to conform the Project hypotheses, the interviews address issues of land reform, labor patterns, race relations, religion, and culture.

 Instructions for use of questionnaire 2 1 undated Interviews 2 2 Aug 1948 Interviews 2 3 Sep 1984 Interviews 2 4 Oct 1948 Interview questionnaires (blank) 2 5 undated Series IV: Journal Entries, January 1948 - April [1949?] Scope and Contents note

Approximately .5 linear feet, arranged chronologically. This series is comprised of bilingual, typescript accounts of field observations that were originally maintained as a journal. Although most of the entries appear to have been submitted by Sidney Mintz and Charles Rosario, the bracketed question marks represent unauthored entries. A small journal kept by Elena Padilla Seda is also included.

 Journal Entires - unsigned 2 6 Jan 1948 Descriptive and historic notes related to interviews, entries S. Mintz 2 7 Aug-Sep 1948, undated Journal Entires, S. Mintz 2 8 Oct 1948 Journal Entires, S. Mintz 2 9 Oct 1948 Journal Entires, S. Mintz 2 10 Oct 1948 Journal Entires, C. Rosario 2 11 Oct-Nov 1948 Journal Entires, S. Mintz 2 12 Nov 1948 Journal Entires, S. Mintz 2 13 Nov 1948 Journal Entires, S. Mintz 2 14 Dec 1948 Journal Entires, C. Rosario [?] 2 15 Dec 1948 Journal Entires, S. Mintz 2 16 Jan 1949 Journal Entires, C. Rosario [?] 2 17 Jan 1949 Journal Entires, C. Rosario [?] 2 18 Jan 1949 Journal Entires, C. Rosario [?]; small, partially used journal containing notes and drawings by Elena Padilla Seda 2 19 Feb 1948-Aug 1949 Journal Entires, C. Rosario [?] 2 20 April [1949?] Series V: Project Reports, 1946 - April 1950 Scope and Contents note

1.0 linear feet arranged chronologically. This series features a number of typescript reports that have been organized as two subseries. Subseries A details the development of research hypotheses. Subseries B consists of statistical data, community studies and reference maps used in the study. Report titles appear in italics.

 Subseries A. Research Methodology Correspondence, master lists of hypotheses 3 1 May-Jun 1948, undated 3 2 May 1948, undated Untitled report regarding research categories; Quantitative data for localities [John Murra?] 3 3 Nov 1948, undated Subseries B. Mintz 3 18 undated [author unknown] 3 19 undated Details to be Observed [relates to children], Kay Wolf 3 20 undated Eric Wolf 3 21 undated [Sidney Mintz?] 3 22 undated [author unknown] 4 1 undated [author unknown] 4 2 undated Ramon Granfa Cordova; handwritten notes 4 3 undated [author unknown] 4 4 undated Summary of [author unknown] 4 5 undated Research notes: Puerto Rico's government and political party system 4 6 undated Research citations, 4 7 undated Research citations, draft notes 4 8 undated [author unknown], draft notes 4 9 undated [author unknown]; miscellaneous, incomplete reports 4 10 undated Series VI: Draft Manuscript Papers, 1948 - 1950, undated Scope and Contents note

Approximately .75 linear feet (1 AB, four folders), arranged chronologically. This series consists of a draft manuscript, that may represent efforts to organize the final report. Sequentially numbered and coded to conform to the Project hypotheses (see Series V. Project Reports, subseries a. Research Methodology), the manuscript is a compilation of journal entries, interviews and community studies. The following sections are missing: pp. 124 - 235, 236 - 304, 563 - 734, and 1412 - 1571.

 Draft Manuscripts: Introductory material 4 11 1948-1949[?] Draft Manuscripts: pp. 447 - 476 4 12 Oct 1948 Draft Manuscripts: pp. 477 - 493 4 13 Oct 1948 Draft Manuscripts: pp. 494 - 527 4 14 Oct 1948 Draft Manuscripts: pp. 528 - 562 4 15 Oct 1948 Draft Manuscripts: [Note: Fieldwork in Norcora], genealogical chart, pp. 946 - 1006 4 16 Jan 1949 Draft Manuscripts: pp. 1007 - 1063 4 17 Jan 1949 Draft Manuscripts: pp. 1064 - 1100 5 1 Feb 1949 Draft Manuscripts: pp. 1101 - 1162 5 2 Feb 1949 Draft Manuscripts: pp. 1288 - 1367 5 3 Apr 1949 Draft Manuscripts: Memo from JHS [Julian H. Steward] manuscript outline 5 4 Jul 1950 Series VII: Miscellaneous Papers, Dec 1943; 1947 - Feb 1949, undated Scope and Contents note

.5 linear feet (1 AB). Arranged chronologically. This series contains varied materials, including printed matter, theatre advertisements, a photograph contact sheet and ephemera. Items of special interest include a form letter signed by former Puerto Rico governor Luis Munoz and political flyers.

 Form letter signed by former Governor Luis Munoz Marin 5 5 Dec. 1943 Anthrolopogy-Sociology class calendar; outline, bibliography; essay on folk society, notes 5 6 1947 Programs for Teatro Taboas and Teatro Boringuen in Manati, Puerto Rico 5 7 Jun 1948-Jul 1948 Political flyers for in Cauguas, Puerto Rico; related voting material 5 8 Sep 1948 , undated Brochures and print material detailing cooperative credit unions in Puerto Rico 5 9 undated Photo Contact sheet of children in urban setting 5 10 undated Notes 5 11 undated Notes 5 12 undated Series VIII: Maps, Mar 1944 - May 1946, undated Scope and Contents note

1.0 linear feet (2 folders, 1 oversized box), arranged according to size. The oversized material in this series includes government, regional and land use maps of Puerto Rico. Hand drawn maps of local communities are also included.

 Appendix Scope and Contents note

Two additional monographs, a thesis and manuscript, formerly housed in the Library for Caribbean Research (LCR) at the Research Institute for the Study of Man, have been appended to the collection. These items provide document the fieldwork phase of the Project.

 Report on the Selection of a Community for Anthropological Study, by Isabel S. Caro 7 1 Dec 1951 Canamelar: The Subculture of a Rural Sugar Plantation Proletariat, by Sidney Mintz 7 2 undated
